title: Introduction to Physical AI & ROS 2

learning_outcomes.outcome: Define Physical AI and distinguish it from traditional AI systems
learning_outcomes.assessment: Student can compare ChatGPT, Tesla Autopilot, and Boston Dynamics Atlas with clear distinctions between digital, physical, and embodied AI

learning_outcomes.outcome: Explain embodied intelligence and its significance in robotics
learning_outcomes.assessment: Student can explain sensor-actuator loops, real-world constraints (gravity, friction, latency), and morphological computation

learning_outcomes.outcome: Understand the ROS 2 architecture and core communication patterns
learning_outcomes.assessment: Student can explain pub/sub, services, and actions with correct use cases and trade-offs

learning_outcomes.outcome: Build functional ROS 2 nodes using Python (rclpy)
learning_outcomes.assessment: Student can write and run publisher/subscriber nodes and understand parameter management

learning_outcomes.outcome: Describe robot structure using URDF format
learning_outcomes.assessment: Student can modify URDF, visualize changes in RViz, and explain links, joints, visual/collision geometry

chapter_objectives: By the end of Chapter 1, students transition from understanding traditional AI limitations to appreciating embodied intelligence through physical systems, and gain practical experience with ROS 2 as the foundational middleware for robot control.
next_chapter_prerequisites: Understanding of ROS 2 nodes and pub/sub messaging
Ability to read and modify URDF files
Familiarity with Python type hints and callbacks
